title: 114_hr1928
content: The Act titled "Empowering Parents to Invest in Choice Act of 2015" extends qualified tuition programs to cover elementary and secondary education expenses. The Act "Empowering Parents to Invest in Choice Act of 2015" expands qualified tuition programs to include qualified education expenses for elementary and secondary education as well as higher education. The Act "Empowering Parents to Invest in Choice Act of 2015" allows for qualified education expenses for elementary and secondary education, including academic tutoring, special needs services, books, supplies, equipment, computer technology, and Internet access. The Act allows for qualified education expenses for elementary and secondary education, including academic tutoring, special needs services, books, supplies, equipment, computer technology, and Internet access. Expenses for computer software designed for sports, games, or hobbies are not included unless the software is predominantly educational. The term 'school' refers to any school providing elementary or secondary education as determined by State law. The term 'qualified higher education expenses' includes tuition, fees, books, supplies, and equipment for enrollment at an eligible educational institution. Special needs services expenses for special needs beneficiaries are also covered. Room and board are included for students who are at least half-time. The term 'qualified higher education expenses' includes tuition, fees, books, supplies, equipment, and room and board for students who are at least half-time. The amount treated as qualified higher education expenses shall not exceed the allowance for room and board included in the cost of attendance as determined by the eligible educational institution. The actual invoice amount charged by the educational institution for room and board costs for students residing in campus housing is considered as qualified education expenses. Amendments are made to sections of the Code to reflect this change. Amendments are made to various sections of the Code to replace "qualified higher education expenses" with "qualified education expenses". This includes changes in subsections (b)(1)(A)(i), (b)(1)(A)(ii), (b)(6), (c)(3)(B)(ii)(I), (c)(3)(B)(v), (c)(3)(B)(vi)(II), and (c)(6). Additionally, section 530(b) is amended to renumber paragraphs, and section 1400O(1) is amended to update a reference. These amendments have an effective date. The effective date for the amendments made in this section is after December 31, 2014. SEC. 3. INCREASED LIMITATION ON CONTRIBUTIONS TO COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. The contribution limit to Coverdell Education Savings Accounts is increased from $2,000 to $15,000, with an inflation adjustment provision for taxable years after 2015. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014, with any increase rounded to the nearest multiple of $100.
